metadata.description: Enhanced lunar missions database with instrument details, vendors, costs, and publications

missions.name: Apollo 11
missions.description: First crewed Moon landing mission. Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the lunar surface.

payloads.name: Early Apollo Scientific Experiments Package (EASEP)
payloads.description: Simplified precursor to ALSEP for rapid deployment
payloads.specifications: Passive Seismic Experiment (PSE) and Lunar Dust Detector
payloads.core_science: First seismic measurements on the Moon, dust accumulation monitoring

payloads.name: Passive Seismic Experiment
payloads.description: Detected moonquakes and meteorite impacts
payloads.core_science: Detection of moonquakes, meteorite impacts, and internal structure

missions.name: Apollo 12
missions.description: Second crewed Moon landing. Deployed first full ALSEP and retrieved parts from Surveyor 3.

payloads.name: Apollo Lunar Surface Experiments Package (ALSEP)
payloads.description: Suite of automated scientific instruments powered by RTG
payloads.specifications: First full ALSEP deployment with plutonium-238 RTG
payloads.core_science: Long-term automated surface experiments including seismology and magnetometry

missions.name: Apollo 15
missions.description: First J-mission with extended stay, Lunar Roving Vehicle, and Scientific Instrument Module.

publications.title: Lunar Surface Radioactivity: Apollo 15 and Apollo 16 Gamma-Ray Spectrometer Experiments

payloads.name: Gamma-Ray Spectrometer
payloads.description: Measured chemical composition of lunar surface
payloads.core_science: Elemental composition mapping (Th, U, K, Fe, Mg, Al, Si)

payloads.name: Mass Spectrometer
payloads.description: Measured composition of lunar atmosphere
payloads.core_science: Measured lunar exosphere composition and density

missions.name: Luna 25
missions.failure_reason: Onboard control system failure - engine ran for 127 seconds instead of 84, creating impact trajectory
missions.description: Russia's first lunar mission since 1976. Crashed during descent after control system malfunction.

publications.title: Russia Traces Luna-25 Crash to Onboard Control System Failure

payloads.name: Lunar Manipulator Complex (LMK)
payloads.description: Capable of excavating lunar regolith
payloads.core_science: Soil sampling and mechanical properties measurement

payloads.name: ADRON-LR
payloads.description: Active neutron and gamma-ray analysis of regolith
payloads.core_science: Subsurface water ice and hydrogen detection

missions.name: Hakuto-R Mission 1
missions.failure_reason: Radar altimeter misinterpretation - lander hovered at 5km until fuel depletion
missions.description: First commercial lunar landing attempt by Japanese company ispace. Crashed due to altitude sensor error.

publications.title: HAKUTO-R Mission 2's Crash was Caused by its Laser Range Finder

payloads.name: Rashid Rover
payloads.description: UAE's first lunar rover with cameras and sensors
payloads.core_science: Surface imaging and thermal properties

missions.name: Peregrine Mission One
missions.failure_reason: Propellant leak prevented lunar orbit insertion, controlled reentry after 10 days
missions.description: First CLPS mission. Suffered propulsion failure shortly after launch, prevented from reaching Moon.

publications.title: Payload Research: The Ultra Low-Cost Economics of NASA's CLPS Lunar Program

payloads.name: Peregrine Ion-Trap Mass Spectrometer (PITMS)
payloads.description: Lunar exosphere composition measurement
payloads.vendor: NASA Goddard Space Flight Center / ESA
payloads.core_science: Measure volatiles released during lunar sunrise

payloads.name: Neutron Spectrometer System (NSS)
payloads.description: Detects neutrons to infer hydrogen/water ice
payloads.core_science: Hydrogen detection in regolith for water ice mapping

missions.name: SLIM (Smart Lander for Investigating Moon)
missions.failure_reason: Solar panels not functioning properly - landed upside down but survived
missions.description: Japan's precision landing demonstrator. Landed successfully but upside down, solar panels facing wrong direction. Later revived when Sun angle changed.

payloads.name: Multi-Band Camera (MBC)
payloads.description: Multi-band spectroscopic imaging for mineral identification
payloads.core_science: Olivine composition analysis to study lunar mantle

payloads.name: LEV-1 (Lunar Excursion Vehicle)
payloads.description: Small hopping robot with camera
payloads.core_science: Lander imaging and hopping mobility demonstration

missions.name: Chandrayaan-3
missions.description: First spacecraft to land near the lunar south pole. Successfully deployed Pragyan rover.

publications.title: First analysis of Chandrayaan-3 south pole regolith samples
publications.findings: High sulphur, low sodium/potassium vs Apollo 16 and Luna 20

payloads.name: APXS (Alpha Particle X-ray Spectrometer)
payloads.description: Determined elemental composition of lunar soil
payloads.core_science: Elemental analysis: high S, low Na/K detected at south pole
payloads.key_findings: First detection of sulphur in south polar regolith

payloads.name: LIBS (Laser Induced Breakdown Spectroscope)
payloads.description: Analyzed elemental composition near landing site
payloads.core_science: In-situ elemental composition via laser ablation spectroscopy

payloads.name: ILSA (Instrument for Lunar Seismic Activity)
payloads.description: Detected moonquakes and seismic activity
payloads.core_science: First seismic measurements at south pole

payloads.name: ChaSTE (Chandra's Surface Thermo-physical Experiment)
payloads.description: Measured thermal properties of lunar surface
payloads.core_science: Temperature gradient measurement in south polar regolith

missions.name: Intuitive Machines IM-1 (Odysseus)
missions.failure_reason: Tipped over on landing due to faster-than-expected descent, but transmitted data
missions.description: First commercial spacecraft to land on the Moon. Part of NASA's CLPS program. Landed successfully but tipped over.

payloads.name: Navigation Doppler Lidar (NDL)
payloads.description: Precision landing technology demonstration
payloads.core_science: Demonstrates precision landing for future missions

payloads.name: Laser Retroreflector Array (LRA)
payloads.description: Passive ranging target for future missions
payloads.core_science: Permanent geodetic reference point

missions.name: Firefly Aerospace Blue Ghost 1
missions.description: Delivering 10 NASA CLPS science payloads to Mare Crisium. Includes heat flow probe requiring 3-meter drilling.

payloads.name: Lunar Magnetotelluric Sounder
payloads.description: Measures magnetic field and electrical conductivity
payloads.specifications: Magnetometer on extendable boom and 4 cables launched to 65 feet by springs
payloads.core_science: First spring-launched cable system in space, probes subsurface electrical properties

payloads.name: Lunar Heat Flow Probe
payloads.description: Measures subsurface heat flow
payloads.core_science: First deep heat flow measurement since Apollo

payloads.name: Regolith Adherence Characterization (RAC)
payloads.description: Studies dust adherence properties
payloads.core_science: Dust accumulation for future hardware design

missions.name: Intuitive Machines IM-2
missions.description: Second Intuitive Machines mission landing near the lunar South Pole. Features PRIME-1 ice mining experiment.

payloads.name: PRIME-1 Drill
payloads.description: Subsurface drilling for ice detection
payloads.core_science: First in-situ resource utilization (ISRU) demonstration on Moon

payloads.name: PRIME-1 Mass Spectrometer
payloads.description: Analyzes volatile composition
payloads.core_science: Identifies water, CO2, and other volatiles in regolith

missions.name: Artemis III
missions.description: First crewed lunar landing since Apollo 17. Will land near the South Pole to study water ice.

publications.title: NASA Selects First Lunar Instruments for Artemis Astronaut Deployment

payloads.name: LEMS (Lunar Environment Monitoring Station)
payloads.description: Compact, autonomous seismometer characterizing regional lunar structure
payloads.core_science: Crust and mantle structure at south pole

payloads.name: LEAF (Lunar Effects on Agricultural Flora)
payloads.description: Investigates impact of lunar environment on space crops
payloads.core_science: Plant growth in lunar gravity and radiation

payloads.name: LDA (Lunar Dielectric Analyzer)
payloads.description: Measures regolith's ability to propagate electric field
payloads.core_science: Subsurface ice detection via dielectric properties

missions.name: Chang'e-4
missions.description: First spacecraft to land on the far side of the Moon. Deployed Yutu-2 rover.

publications.title: The scientific objectives and payloads of Chang'E−4 mission

payloads.name: Lunar Penetrating Radar (LPR)
payloads.description: Subsurface structure investigation
payloads.vendor: Institute of Electronics, Chinese Academy of Sciences
payloads.core_science: Penetrated 40m depth, revealed subsurface layering on far side

payloads.name: Visible/Near-Infrared Imaging Spectrometer (VNIS)
payloads.description: Mineralogical analysis
payloads.core_science: First detection of mantle material (olivine, pyroxene) on surface

payloads.name: Low-Frequency Radio Spectrometer (LFS)
payloads.description: Radio astronomy observations from far side
payloads.core_science: Radio astronomy free from Earth interference

missions.name: Luna 17 / Lunokhod 1
missions.description: First successful rover mission. Lunokhod 1 operated for 322 Earth days and traveled 10.54 km.

payloads.name: RIFMA X-ray Fluorescence Spectrometer
payloads.description: Performed elemental analysis of lunar soil
payloads.core_science: First mobile elemental composition measurements

payloads.name: Penetrometer
payloads.description: Measured mechanical properties of regolith
payloads.core_science: Soil bearing strength and density measurements

payloads.name: Cosmic Ray Detectors
payloads.description: Detected cosmic radiation
payloads.core_science: Surface radiation environment characterization

missions.name: Artemis Lunar Terrain Vehicle
missions.description: Pressurized rover for Artemis missions. Can operate autonomously or with crew.

publications.title: NASA Selects Instruments for Artemis Lunar Terrain Vehicle

payloads.name: AIRES (Artemis Infrared Reflectance and Emission Spectrometer)
payloads.description: Identifies, quantifies, and maps lunar minerals and volatiles
payloads.core_science: Real-time mineral and volatile mapping during traverses

payloads.name: L-MAPS (Lunar Microwave Active-Passive Spectrometer)
payloads.description: Defines subsurface structure and searches for ice
payloads.core_science: Deep subsurface temperature, density, and ice detection
